Diagnosis
	1. WNT-activated medulloblastoma, M0 stage

	Date of diagnosis
	March 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Mar 2024 Complete surgical resection of posterior fossa mass

	Radiotherapy
	Planned but not yet commenced

	Chemotherapy
	Not yet commenced

	Clinical studies
	WNT-MB-04 trial registration completed today

	Current disease status
	Post-operative, no evidence of residual disease

	Current issues
	Mild post-operative cerebellar syndrome

	Summary of consultation
	This 8-year-old boy attended with his parents for trial registration following complete resection of a WNT-activated medulloblastoma. Post-operative MRI on 22/3/24 confirms complete resection with no evidence of dissemination. CSF cytology from 20/3/24 is negative for malignant cells. Molecular analysis confirms WNT-activation with nuclear beta-catenin positivity and CTNNB1 mutation.

He has made an excellent post-operative recovery with improving balance and coordination. Currently mobilising independently with mild ataxia. No cranial nerve deficits. Performance status is 1.

We have thoroughly discussed the WNT-MB-04 trial which is investigating reduced-intensity treatment in WNT-activated medulloblastoma. The family understands the rationale for de-escalation given the excellent prognosis of this molecular subgroup. We reviewed all eligibility criteria, which are met. Trial-specific assessments including audiometry, endocrine evaluation, and neuropsychology testing have been scheduled.

	Further investigations
	Baseline trial assessments:
	- Pure tone audiometry 28/3/24
	- Endocrine assessment 29/3/24
	- Neuropsychology evaluation 1/4/24

	Medication prescribed
	Dexamethasone weaning regime as per protocol

	Follow up
	Trial baseline visit scheduled for 3/4/24
Radiotherapy planning appointment 5/4/24

	Required GP actions
	Weekly FBC, U&E, LFT monitoring during radiotherapy phase

	Summary of information given to the patient
	Full trial information provided including treatment schedule, required assessments, and potential risks/benefits. Written information given regarding radiotherapy preparation.
